subject: Mental Health
title: Cultural Views on Anxiety
description: A quick, practical guide to Cultural Views on Anxiety.

hook.text: In Japan, social anxiety is so widespread there's a word for it: taijin kyofusho.

buildup.text: Cultures frame anxiety as spiritual, moral, physical, or psychological.

discovery.text: Western medicine sees a brain disorder; other traditions see energy imbalance.

twist.text: Cultural stigma determines whether people get therapy, herbs, or shame.

climax.text: Understanding cultural context is essential for accurate global treatment.

quiz.question: What is taijin kyofusho?
options: A Japanese term for social anxiety
